comments:
I'll try to give a background to what I was doing prior to discovering this bug, I  don't know how much of it will be relevant, but anyway: It all started when I recently downloaded eclipse 3.2 and the calisto version of WST. I had previously used 3.1 with XML buddy, Tomcat Plugin etc. but was hoping WST would offer everything I needed to developed web pages and servlets etc. I'm using Tapestry, Spring, Hibernate to develop my webapp, and as certain xml files in tapestry are not recognized by eclipse (*.jwc, *.page) I added them to Content Types->Text_>XML. So far, so good, everything working as it should, I came back to work this morning however, and when I tried to open .jwc file, I got a null pointer exception, it opens in text editor no problem. Tried other tapestry files associated with xml editor, same problem, tried xml files full stop, same problem, same error message. I checked to see if someone else has already logged a bug against this, but can't find one, so here I am typing up what I hope is something that can easily be fixed.

The stack trace is as follows:

This appears to be a duplicate of bug 141013 which has been fixed for WTP 1.5.1.  Specifically see bug 141013 comment 9.  I believe the trick is the order in which you open files.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 141013 ***
Closing as fixed since WTP 1.5.1.  Please reopen if closed in error.
